metadata.subject: Building a Bridge Between FOIA Requesters & Federal Agencies - 2014 Report for FY 2013

organizations: Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
Administrative Conference of the United States
United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)

relationships.description: OGIS is part of the National Archives and Records Administration
OGIS reviews FOIA policies and procedures of federal agencies

analysis.purpose: To report on OGIS's activities and accomplishments in FY 2013, including dispute resolution services, agency reviews, and FOIA improvement recommendations
analysis.significance: Fourth annual report from the FOIA Ombudsman office showing significant growth in caseload and expanding role in FOIA administration

notable_quotes: OGIS strives to be an advocate not for the requester or the agency, but for an effective FOIA process that works as intended.
Demand for OGIS's services is high. Requests for assistance in resolving FOIA disputes greeted me the morning the office opened four years ago.
OGIS's success may not rest in the outcome of mediation services, but in the process of providing mediation services.
red_flags: Persistent issues with FOIA fees and fee waivers

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this government report

illegal_activity.description: This is an official government report about FOIA administration with no illegal activity mentioned

details: Director's participation in Canadian Association of Journalists' World Press Freedom Day

public_knowledge.context: This is an official public report from a government oversight office about FOIA operations, likely of interest to transparency advocates and government watchdog groups

analysis.summary: The OGIS FY 2013 report details a 40% increase in FOIA dispute cases, expanded mediation services, and ongoing reviews of agency FOIA compliance, while outlining recommendations for improving the FOIA process including dispute resolution implementation, fee examination, and immigration records processing.
